ai-mn43:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-mn43:1.3_0: Then in the late afternoon, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita came out of retreat, went to Venerable Sāriputta,
ai-mn43:1.3_1: and after going, he exchanged greetings with him.
ai-mn43:1.4_0: and after exchanging courteous talk and greetings, he sat down on one side.
ai-mn43:2.2_0: How is a witless person defined?”
ai-mn43:2.3_0: “Reverend, they’re called witless because they don’t understand.
ai-mn43:2.5_0: They don’t understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’
ai-mn43:2.6_0: They’re called witless because they don’t understand.”
ai-mn43:2.7_0: Saying “Good, reverend,” Mahākoṭṭhita approved and agreed with what Sāriputta said. Then he asked another question:
ai-mn43:3.2_0: How is a wise person defined?”
ai-mn43:3.5_0: They understand: ‘This is suffering’ ... ‘This is the origin of suffering’ ... ‘This is the cessation of suffering’ ... ‘This is the practice that leads to the cessation of suffering.’
ai-mn43:3.6_0: They’re called wise because they understand.”
ai-mn43:4.6_0: It’s called consciousness because it cognizes.”
ai-mn43:5.2_0: are these things mixed or separate?
ai-mn43:5.3_0: And can we completely dissect them so as to describe the difference between them?”
ai-mn43:5.5_0: these things are mixed, not separate.
ai-mn43:5.6_0: And you can never completely dissect them so as to describe the difference between them.
ai-mn43:5.7_0: For you understand what you cognize, and you cognize what you understand.
ai-mn43:5.8_0: That’s why these things are mixed, not separate.
ai-mn43:5.9_0: And you can never completely dissect them so as to describe the difference between them.”
ai-mn43:6.2_0: What is the difference between them?”
ai-mn43:6.4_0: “The difference between these things is that wisdom should be developed, while consciousness should be completely understood.”
ai-mn43:6.5_0: this is there a difference between them.”
ai-mn43:7.5_0: That which is pleasant, painful, and neutral.
ai-mn43:7.6_0: It’s called feeling because it feels.”
ai-mn43:8.5_0: It perceives blue, yellow, red, and white.
ai-mn43:8.6_0: It’s called perception because it perceives.”
ai-mn43:9.2_0: are these things mixed or separate?
ai-mn43:9.3_0: And can we completely dissect them so as to describe the difference between them?”
ai-mn43:9.5_0: these things are mixed, not separate.
ai-mn43:9.6_0: And you can never completely dissect them so as to describe the difference between them.
ai-mn43:9.7_0: For you perceive what you feel, and you cognize what you perceive.
ai-mn43:9.8_0: That’s why these things are mixed, not separate.
ai-mn43:9.9_0: And you can never completely dissect them so as to describe the difference between them.”
ai-mn43:10.1_0: “Aware that any faculty of mind would arise with the five faculties?”
ai-mn43:10.2_0: “Aware that ‘space is infinite’ it can know the dimension of infinite space. Aware that ‘consciousness is infinite’ it can know the dimension of infinite consciousness. Aware that ‘there is nothing at all’ it can know the dimension of nothingness.”
ai-mn43:11.1_0: “How do you understand something that can be known?”
ai-mn43:11.2_0: “You understand something that can be known with the eye of wisdom.”
ai-mn43:12.2_0: “The purpose of wisdom is direct knowledge, complete understanding, and giving up.”
ai-mn43:13.1_0: “How many conditions are necessary to give rise to right view?”
ai-mn43:13.2_0: “There are two conditions for the arising of right view:
ai-mn43:13.3_0: the words of another and proper attention.
ai-mn43:13.4_0: These are the two conditions for the arising of right view.”
ai-mn43:14.1_0: “When right view is supported by how many factors does it have freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as its fruit and benefit?”
ai-mn43:14.2_0: “When right view is supported by five factors it has freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as its fruit and benefit.
ai-mn43:14.3_0: It’s when someone has right view, right thought, right speech, right action, right livelihood, right effort, right mindfulness, and right immersion. They grow on the side, and they keep on distinguished.
ai-mn43:14.4_0: When right view is supported by these five factors it has freedom of heart and freedom by wisdom as its fruit and benefit.”
ai-mn43:15.1_0: “How many states of existence are there?”
ai-mn43:15.2_0: “Reverend, there are these three states of existence.
ai-mn43:16.1_0: “But how is there rebirth into a new state of existence in the future?”
ai-mn43:16.2_0: “Ignorance is a intention and advocate for sentient beings. In this way the fetter of craving—
ai-mn43:16.3_0: That’s how there is rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.”
ai-mn43:17.1_0: “But how is there no rebirth into a new state of existence in the future?”
ai-mn43:17.2_0: “Ignorance ceases when ignorance ceases, craving ceases.
ai-mn43:17.3_0: That’s how there is no rebirth into a new state of existence in the future.”
ai-mn43:18.1_0: “But what, reverend, is the first absorption?”
ai-mn43:18.2_0: “Reverend, it’s when a mendicant, quite secluded from sensual pleasures, secluded from unskillful qualities, enters and remains in the first absorption, which has the rapture and bliss born of seclusion, while placing the mind and keeping it connected.
ai-mn43:18.3_0: This is called the first absorption.”
ai-mn43:19.1_0: “But how many factors does the first absorption have?”
ai-mn43:19.3_0: When a mendicant has entered the first absorption, placing the mind, keeping it connected, rapture, bliss, and unification of mind are present.
ai-mn43:19.4_0: That’s how the first absorption has five factors.”
ai-mn43:20.1_0: “But how many factors has the first absorption given up and how many does it possess?”
ai-mn43:20.2_0: “The first absorption has given up five factors and possesses five factors.
ai-mn43:20.3_0: When a mendicant has entered the first absorption, sensual desire, ill will, dullness and drowsiness, restlessness and remorse, and doubt are given up.
ai-mn43:20.4_0: Placing the mind, keeping it connected, rapture, bliss, and unification of mind are present.
ai-mn43:20.5_0: That’s how the first absorption has given up five factors and possesses five factors.”
ai-mn43:21.1_0: “Reverend, these five faculties have different scopes and different ranges, and don’t experience each others’ scope and range. That is,
ai-mn43:21.2_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-mn43:21.3_0: What do these five faculties, with their different scopes and ranges, have recourse to? What experiences their scopes and ranges?”
ai-mn43:21.4_0: “Reverend, these five faculties have different scopes and different ranges, and don’t experience each others’ scope and range. That is,
ai-mn43:21.5_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-mn43:21.6_0: “These five faculties, with their different scopes and ranges, have recourse to the mind. And the mind experiences their scopes and ranges.”
ai-mn43:22.1_0: “Reverend, these five faculties are these five faculties. That is:
ai-mn43:22.2_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-mn43:22.3_0: “What are these five faculties, reverends, what is their dependence?”
ai-mn43:22.4_0: “Reverend, these five faculties are these five faculties. That is:
ai-mn43:22.5_0: eye, ear, nose, tongue, and body.
ai-mn43:22.6_0: “These five faculties depend on life to continue.”
ai-mn43:22.7_0: “But what does warmth depend on to continue?”
ai-mn43:22.9_0: “But what does warmth depend on to continue?”
ai-mn43:22.11_0: “Just now I understood you to say:
ai-mn43:22.13_0: But I also understood you to say:
ai-mn43:22.15_0: How then should we see the meaning of this statement?”
ai-mn43:22.16_0: “Well then, reverend, I shall give you a simile.
ai-mn43:22.17_0: For by means of a simile some sensible people understand the meaning of what is said.
ai-mn43:22.18_0: Suppose there was an oil lamp burning. The light appears dependent on the flame, and the flame appears dependent on the light.
ai-mn43:22.19_0: In the same way, life depends on warmth to continue, and warmth depends on life to continue.”
ai-mn43:23.1_0: “Is the life forces are the same things as the phenomena that are felt? Or are one thing different things differently felt?”
ai-mn43:23.2_0: “The life forces are not the same things as the phenomena that are felt.
ai-mn43:23.3_0: For those things have ended the life forces and the phenomena that are felt are not feeling, perception, and cessation regarding perception and feeling.
ai-mn43:23.4_0: But because the life forces and the phenomena that are felt are different things, a mendicant who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling can emerge from it.”
ai-mn43:24.1_0: “How many things must this body give up
ai-mn43:24.1_1: This body is tiny, and like tossed as one that has been defecated.”
ai-mn43:24.2_0: “When this body breaks up, three things make an efforts give up.
ai-mn43:24.2_1: This body is tiny, and like tossed as one that has been defecated.”
ai-mn43:25.1_0: “What’s the difference between someone who has passed away and a mendicant who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling?”
ai-mn43:25.2_0: “When someone dies, their physical, verbal, and mental processes have ceased and stilled; their vitality is spent; their warmth is dissipated; and their faculties have disintegrated.
ai-mn43:25.3_0: When a mendicant has attained the cessation of perception and feeling, their physical, verbal, and mental processes have ceased and stilled. But their vitality is not spent; their warmth is not dissipated; and their faculties are very clear.
ai-mn43:25.4_0: That’s the difference between someone who has passed away and a mendicant who has attained the cessation of perception and feeling.”
ai-mn43:26.1_0: “How many conditions are necessary to attain the neutral release of the heart?”
ai-mn43:26.2_0: “Four conditions are necessary to attain the neutral release of the heart.
ai-mn43:26.3_0: Giving up pleasure and pain, and ending former happiness and sadness, they enter and remain in the fourth absorption, without pleasure or pain, with pure equanimity and mindfulness.
ai-mn43:26.4_0: These are the four conditions for the attainment of the neither-painful-nor-pleasant mind-deliverance” .
ai-mn43:27.1_0: “How many conditions are necessary to attain the signless release of the heart?”
ai-mn43:27.2_0: “Two conditions are necessary to attain the signless release of the heart:
ai-mn43:27.3_0: not focusing on any signs, and focusing on the signless.
ai-mn43:27.4_0: These two conditions are necessary to attain the signless release of the heart.”
ai-mn43:27.5_0: “How many conditions are necessary to remain in the signless release of the heart?”
ai-mn43:28.1_0: “Reverends, there are three conditions for the signless release of the heart:
ai-mn43:28.2_0: not focusing on any signs, focusing on the signless, and a previous determination.
ai-mn43:28.3_0: These three conditions are necessary to remain in the signless release of the heart.”
ai-mn43:29.1_0: “How many conditions are necessary to emerge from the signless release of the heart?”
ai-mn43:29.2_0: “Two conditions are necessary to emerge from the signless release of the heart:
ai-mn43:29.3_0: not focusing on any signs, and focusing on the signless.
ai-mn43:29.4_0: These two conditions are necessary to emerge from the signless release of the heart.”
ai-mn43:29.5_0: “The limitless release of the heart, and the release of the heart through nothingness, and the release of the heart through emptiness, and the signless release of the heart: do these things differ in both meaning and phrasing? Or do they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing?”
ai-mn43:30.1_0: “There is a way in which these things differ in both meaning and phrasing.
ai-mn43:30.2_0: But there’s also a way in which they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing.
ai-mn43:31.1_0: And what’s the way in which these things differ in both meaning and phrasing?
ai-mn43:31.2_0: Firstly, a mendicant meditates spreading a heart full of love to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth.
ai-mn43:31.2_1: In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of love to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.
ai-mn43:31.5_0: equanimity to one direction, and to the second, and to the third, and to the fourth.
ai-mn43:31.5_1: In the same way above, below, across, everywhere, all around, they spread a heart full of equanimity to the whole world—abundant, expansive, limitless, free of enmity and ill will.
ai-mn43:31.6_0: This is called the limitless release of the heart.
ai-mn43:32.1_0: And what is the release of the heart through nothingness?
ai-mn43:32.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, going totally beyond the dimension of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing at all’, enters and remains in the dimension of nothingness.
ai-mn43:32.3_0: This is called the heart’s release through nothingness.
ai-mn43:33.1_0: And what is the release of the heart through emptiness?
ai-mn43:33.2_0: It’s when a mendicant has gone to a wilderness, or to the root of a tree, or to an empty hut, and reflects like this:
ai-mn43:33.3_0: ‘This self or what belongs to self.’
ai-mn43:33.4_0: This is called the release of the heart through emptiness.
ai-mn43:34.1_0: And what is the signless release of the heart?
ai-mn43:34.2_0: It’s when a mendicant, not focusing on any signs, enters and remains in the signless immersion of the heart.
ai-mn43:34.3_0: This is called the signless release of the heart.
ai-mn43:34.4_0: This is the way in which these things differ in both meaning and phrasing.
ai-mn43:35.1_0: And what’s the way in which they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing?
ai-mn43:35.2_0: Greed, hate, and delusion are makers of limits.
ai-mn43:35.3_0: A mendicant who has ended the defilements has given these up, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, and obliterated them, so they are unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn43:35.4_0: The unshakable release of the heart is said to be the best kind of limitless release of the heart.
ai-mn43:35.5_0: That unshakable release of the heart is empty of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-mn43:36.1_0: Greed is something, hate is something, and delusion is something.
ai-mn43:36.2_0: A mendicant who has ended the defilements has given these up, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, and obliterated them, so they are unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn43:36.3_0: The unshakable release of the heart is said to be the best kind of release of the heart through nothingness.
ai-mn43:36.4_0: That unshakable release of the heart is empty of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-mn43:37.1_0: Greed, hate, and delusion are makers of signs.
ai-mn43:37.2_0: A mendicant who has ended the defilements has given these up, cut them off at the root, made them like a palm stump, and obliterated them, so they are unable to arise in the future.
ai-mn43:37.3_0: The unshakable release of the heart is said to be the best kind of signless release of the heart.
ai-mn43:37.4_0: That unshakable release of the heart is empty of greed, hate, and delusion.
ai-mn43:37.5_0: This is the way in which they mean the same thing, and differ only in the phrasing.”
ai-mn43:37.6_0: This is what Venerable Sāriputta said.
ai-mn43:37.7_0: Satisfied, Venerable Mahākoṭṭhita was happy with what Sāriputta said.
